title: 12 Essential Visualizations and How to Implement Them - part 1
description: We look at how to create the 12 most useful graphs and charts with Python, Matplotlib and Streamlit.

title: NASA Open APIs: The Astronomy Picture of the Day in Streamlit
description: Streamlit is not just for Data Science, you can create excellent general-purpose web sites, too. Here we use the NASA Open API and show how to keep your API key a secret.

title: How to Create a Grid Layout in Streamlit
description: We present a method to programmatically create a grid layout in Streamlit with a World population data demonstration app

title: Streamlit from Scratch 1: Getting Started
description: Which tools do you need and how to use them; and how to create your first interactive web app in Python

title: Streamlit from Scratch 2: Embedding images, video and audio
description: Media from the Apollo 11 Moon landing as a Streamlit app

title: PyScript v. Flask: How to Create a Python App in the Browser or on a Server
description: PyScript lets you create web apps in Python without the need for a server. Flask is a Python web app framework for making server-based apps. We write the same simple app using both

title: Plotting with Pandas: An Introduction to Data Visualization
description: If you are a budding Data Scientist or Data Journalist, being able to visualize your data gives you the ability to better understand it

title: 4 Ways to Create a Multi-Page Streamlit App
description: Streamlit may not have been designed for full blown web sites but it is fairly straightforward to create multiple pages in a single appt

title: How to use Ploty with PyScript
description: PyScript doesn’t support Plotly directly but there is a simple way around it

title: Create an Interactive Web App with PyScript and Pandas
description: PyScript allows us to create a serverless web application with HTML and Python as the scripting language.

title: Visualizing Health Risk
description: The press can very easily get it wrong when dealing with health risk data. Data visualizations can help.

title: How to Use Wikipedia as a Data Source
description: How to load information from Wikipedia into Pandas by finding the best team in the English Premier League

title: Customizing Streamlit Columns
description: Streamlit has a limited layout model and this is normally an advantage as it allows the simple construction of sophisticated apps. But sometimes you want to modify the layout.

title: Plotly with Streamlit, Dash or Flask
description: Which is the best framework for your data science apps

title: Mean, Median and Mode: What Are They and When Should You Use Them?
description: You probably remember Mean, Median, and Mode from high school stats classes but they are often misused. We look at how you should use them — with Python and Pandas examples.

title: How to Share your Jupyter Notebook with Mercury or Voilà
description: Putting your Jupyter notebook on the web is reasonably easy with either Mercury or Voilà but which is easier - here's a brief comparison of the two technologies

title: Publish Your Streamlit Apps in the Cloud
description: Share your Streamlit apps with these free tools: Streamlit Cloud, Github and VSCode

title: SQL, Pandas or Both - Analysing the UK Electoral System
description: Pandas is great for analysing and plotting data but should you store your data in a database and select it with SQL. Let's take a look at some common operations using Pandas and SQL and see how they compare

title: Data Scientists: Write your Medium Articles in Jupyter
description: Don’t waste time cutting and pasting and making screen shots of data tables, write everything as a Jupyter Notebook and upload to Medium

title: Create a Web App from Your Jupyter Notebook with Mercury
description: You can published you Notebook as an interactive web app with or without the code

title: How Not to Lie with Charts
description: You can use data visualization to inform, or misinform. We look at the things to avoid if you want to do the former and not the latter.

title: Interactive Data Visualization with Julia and Pluto Notebooks
description: Pluto is an important development that allows you to easily interact with your data. We take a quick look at it using the Julia plotting package to easily create impressive graphs.

title: How to Build a Gallery of Streamlit Apps as a Single Web App
description: Download a free template, pop in multiple Streamlit apps and you’ve got a multiple Streamlit apps on a single web page

description: To create a truly interactive app with Dash you need to use callbacks. You can achieve the same thing with Plotly and Flask.

title: Why I’m Using VSCode for Jupyter Notebooks
description: VSCode is a great Python editor and, as I accidentally discovered, good for Jupyter Notebooks, too

title: Topical Plots: Global Warming Heatmaps
description: Which chart will get the message across best

title: ggplot: Grammar of Graphics in Python with Plotnine
description:
Do you wish that Python could emulate the superb visualizations that ggplot gives you in the R language? Well it can.
Plotnine is a powerful graphics library for great visualizations and based on ggplot

title: Data Visualization with Julia and VSCode
description: With Julia and the free VSCode IDE, you can make impressive data visualizations with little programming knowledge.
